snippet: President Obama makes a comeback from weeks in which he was attacked for everything from playing golf to saying “we don’t have a strategy yet.”
abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column lists number of concerns associated with Pres Obama's plan for combating Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; contends that it is difficult for average Americans to know how worried they should be, particularly given language of overblown alarm and confusion coming from many politicians; says one certain thing is that country should do opposite of whatever former Vice Pres Dick Cheney says.
lead_paragraph: President Obama makes a comeback from weeks in which he was attacked for everything from playing golf to saying “we don’t have a strategy yet.”

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
